@sennorX2 @Hanxxs @brettachapman @QuimTorraiPla @MayorBieter Who banalizes repression? Who suffers? Or the one who only observes it and considers that it is not repression?

@sennorX2 @Hanxxs @brettachapman @QuimTorraiPla @MayorBieter OK, 61% of Catalans want a radical change, of them 36% want a federal state and 63% an independent state. This proportion could change if the Spanish government made a federal reform but nobody believes that the rest of the Spanish voters will allow it

@sennorX2 @Hanxxs @brettachapman @QuimTorraiPla @MayorBieter To clarify these doubts the best solution is to vote a referendum: YES or NO. But the government of Spain does not allow it, for the risk of losing. This position isnt democratic, it is going against basic human rights and extending the problem without solving it

@Hanxxs @sennorX2 @brettachapman @QuimTorraiPla @MayorBieter After a year of repression of the Spanish government over the Catalans, in the last official survey of opinion Oct-Nov 2017, in absolute numbers 52% are in favor of independence and 47% opposed (47% supporters, 43% opposed and 10% undecided or not opinion) https://t.co/LLsmZu8HEV
